title: Teenage girl murdered over suspected lovers’ quarrel
byline: A 16-year-old girl was attacked to death with a sharp weapon at her residence in the Panwilatenna area of Millagahamula, within the jurisdiction of the Gampola Police Division, last night (14).

title: Entrepreneurial development essential for achieving govt’s vision to attract investment - PM
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that as the country moves towards a digital economy through a new transformation, all sectors must work together in the national mission of empowering local entrepreneurs.

title: US agrees deal to slash Swiss tariffs to 15% after golden charm offensive
byline: Switzerland and the US have agreed to cut President Donald Trump’s steep 39% tariffs on Swiss imports to 15%, as part of a deal that involves a Swiss promise to invest $200bn (£150bn) in the US.

title: Seven killed, 27 injured in explosion at police station in India’s Kashmir, NDTV reports
byline: At least seven people were killed and 27 injured when a large pile of confiscated explosives in a police station in India’s Kashmir detonated late on Friday, broadcaster NDTV reported, citing sources.

title: Trump cuts tariffs on beef, coffee and other foods as inflation concerns mount
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday rolled back tariffs on more than 200 food products, including such staples as coffee, beef, bananas and orange juice, in the face of growing angst among American consumers about the high cost of groceries.

title: Committee Stage debate of 2026 Appropriation Bill works off today
byline: The debate on the Committee Stage or the Third Reading of the 2026 Appropriation Bill, or the 80th Budget Speech, is scheduled to commence today (15) in parliament.

title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department states that the low-level atmospheric disturbance still persists to the east of the island.

title: World’s top YouTuber MrBeast launches Saudi theme park
byline: The latest celebrity brought to Saudi Arabia in the kingdom’s push to become a global entertainment destination: MrBeast, the most popular YouTuber on the planet.

title: Over 16,000 arrested in “Nation United” island-wide anti-drug raids
byline: More than 16,000 individuals have been arrested thus far during the nationwide operation launched to eradicate drugs from the country under the theme “Nation United – National Drive”, aimed at eradicating narcotics from the country.

title: Second reading vote on 2026 Budget in Parliament today
byline: The Second Reading vote of the 2026 Budget is scheduled to be held today (14) at 6 p.m., the Parliament’s Department of Communication announced.

title: Tourist arrivals in 2025 nearing 2 million
byline: A total of 82,270 tourists have arrived in the country thus far in November, data from the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority shows.

title: Fire breaks out at 1,500-year-old Yongqing temple in China
byline: A fire broke out at the reconstructed historical temple, Yongqing Temple, in Zhangjiagang, Jiangsu on Wednesday.

title: Vote on second reading of 2026 Budget underway
byline: Voting on the second reading of the 2026 Appropriation Bill is currently underway in Parliament.

title: UNP decides to attend Nov. 21 Nugegoda rally
byline: The United National Party (UNP) has decided to attend the rally scheduled to be held on November 21 in Nugegoda.

title: Former NLB Director Thusitha Halloluwa surrenders to court
byline: Former Executive Director of the National Lotteries Board (NLB), Thusitha Halloluwa has appeared before the Colombo Magistrate’s Court this morning (14) after a warrant was issued for his arrest yesterday.

title: World Diabetes Day to be marked with awareness programs
byline: The Sri Lanka Diabetes Federation has organized a social service program to be held tomorrow (15) in commemoration of World Diabetes Day, which falls today (14).

title: TikTok Awards 2025: Max Klymenko named creator of the year
byline: The second annual TikTok awards were a resounding success, showcasing a diverse range of creators who have captivated audiences across the platform.

title: Commuters can pay bus fares using bank cards from Nov. 24 – Transport Minister
byline: Commuters will be able to pay bus fares using bank-issued credit and debit cards on buses equipped with ticket-issuing machines with effect from November 24, 2025, Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation Bimal Rathnayake has stated.

title: Six students from Ruhuna Uni. hospitalised after wasp attack
byline: A group of students from the Faculty of Engineering of the University of Ruhuna have been hospitalized following a wasp attack this morning (14), police reported.

title: Indian state offers menstrual leave to all working women
byline: The southern Indian state of Karnataka, which is also home to some of the world’s biggest IT firms, has become the first in the country to offer paid menstrual leave to all working women in formal jobs.

title: Warrant issued for ex-NLB Director Thusitha Halloluwa’s arrest recalled
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has recalled the arrest warrant issued on former Executive Director of the National Lotteries Board (NLB), Thusitha Halloluwa.

title: New Commissioner General of Elections assumes duties
byline: Rasika Peiris has assumed duties as the New Commissioner General of Elections, effective from today (14).

title: Low-level atmospheric disturbance in east of Sri Lanka to bring heavy showers
byline: The low-level atmospheric disturbance still persists to the east of Sri Lanka, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Govt to expand “Suwa Seriya” ambulance fleet to 500 vehicles
byline: The government has planned to expand the “Suwa Seriya” ambulance fleet to 500 vehicles by integrating the service with the latest technologies, according to Minister of Health and Mass Media, Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa.

title: Motorcyclist killed in hit-and-run accident in Warakapola
byline: A motorcyclist died in a hit-and-run incident early this morning (14) near the 36 Kanda Kovil on the Colombo–Kandy main road in the Warakapola Police Division.

title: Sri Lankan worker found murdered in Israel – Ambassador
byline: A 38-year-old Sri Lankan national from Galle, who had arrived in Israel two months ago for employment in construction sector, was reportedly found murdered last night (13).

title: Ada Derana wins Bronze Award for ‘Innovative Brand of the Year’ at SLIM Awards
byline: “Ada Derana” was presented with the Bronze Award in the ‘Innovative Brand of the Year’ category at the 24th SLIM Brand Excellence Awards held in Colombo last night.

title: Hotel employee arrested for stealing foreign currency from Dutch tourist
byline: A hotel employee has been taken into custody by the Colombo Fort Police following a complaint lodged by a Dutch female tourist regarding the theft of foreign currency from her wallet.

title: US and Sri Lanka sign MOU to formalize defense partnership
byline: The United States and Sri Lanka today signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) at the Ministry of Defense, formalizing a defense partnership between the Montana National Guard, U.S. Coast Guard District 13, and the Sri Lankan Armed Forces under the U.S. Department of Defense’s State Partnership Program (SPP).

title: Second reading of 2026 Budget passed in Parliament
byline: The second reading of the 2026 Appropriation Bill has been passed with a majority of 118 votes in Parliament, a short while ago.

title: Ex-NPP councilor’s husband arrested with drugs not a principal, says union
byline: The Sri Lanka Professional Principals’ Association has issued a statement today (14) clarifying details regarding the alleged school principal who was arrested with narcotics recently.

title: Derana Little Star winner Seheli’s viral video surpasses 312M views on YouTube
byline: A viral video clip of ‘Derana Little Star - Season 10’ winner, Seheli Thurya’s amazing performance during a reality show has now gained over 312.7 million views on TV Derana’s YouTube channel, becoming the single most-watched YouTube Short from a Sri Lankan channel.

title: Chinese astronauts head home after suspected debris strike delays return to Earth
byline: Three Chinese astronauts will return to Earth on Friday, more than a week later than their scheduled landing, capping an extended stay in space after a suspected debris hit left their spaceship with a cracked window.

title: NPP budget defeated in Padiyathalawa PS vote
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) budget has been defeated in the budget vote held at the Padiyathalawa Pradeshiya Sabha.

title: US aircraft carrier nears Venezuela in flex of American military power
byline: The most advanced U.S. aircraft carrier is expected to reach the waters off Venezuela in days, a flex of American military power not seen in Latin America for generations.

title: SriLankan Airlines unveils new self-check-in kiosks
byline: SriLankan Airlines’ Airport and Ground Services, the sole ground handling provider at Sri Lanka’s Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA), has expanded its self-check-in service for passengers of commercial airlines ahead of the upcoming winter travel season.

title: IMF reviewing Sri Lanka’s 2026 Budget as US$ 347M tranche expected ‘in coming weeks’
byline: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) is currently assessing Sri Lanka’s recently announced 2026 budget—including its ambitious 7 percent growth target—to determine whether it aligns with the conditions of the country’s ongoing bailout program.

title: Multiple dead as double-decker bus ploughs through shelter in Stockholm
byline: A bus crashed into a bus shelter central Stockholm with several confirmed fatalities and even more serious injuries.

title: Disney and YouTube TV reach deal ending weeks of disruption
byline: Google’s YouTube and Walt Disney said on Friday they had reached an agreement to restore Disney-owned networks to YouTube TV, after a fee dispute left millions of subscribers without access to U.S. Election Day programming and major live sports events.

title: Indian HC meets ITAK leaders, discusses widening Sri Lanka–India relations
byline: The Indian High Commissioner to Sri Lanka, Santosh Jha has met with Ilankai Tamil Arasu Katchi (ITAK) General Secretary M.A. Sumanthiran and Parliamentarian Shanakiyan Rasamanickam.

title: Disciplinary action against Senior DIG Lalith Pathinayake?
byline: Senior Deputy Inspector General of Police (SDIG) Lalith Pathinayake, who had been serving as the Acting Senior DIG in charge of the Police Administration Division, has reportedly been removed from the position by the National Police Commission, pending disciplinary action.

title: Select committee to review legal framework for PC polls - Bimal
byline: Leader of the House, Minister Bimal Ratnayake, informed Parliament that a Select Committee will be appointed to review the legal framework pertaining to the conduct of Provincial Council Elections and to take the necessary steps to expedite the electoral process.

title: Nov. 21 rally not to elevate anyone to power, but to remind govt of promises – Namal
byline: Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa has accused the government of carrying out a severe crackdown on public servants, stating that the current period is a highly challenging one for many.

title: Labubu movie in the works for the big screen, report says
byline: The popular Labubu dolls that have ignited a global frenzy may light up movie screens in the future, the Hollywood Reporter said on Friday.

title: Gold prices in Sri Lanka drop by Rs. 10,000 today
byline: The price of gold in Sri Lanka has decreased by Rs. 10,000 compared to yesterday (14).

title: Google reportedly developing Android version of Apple’s NameDrop feature
byline: Android users may soon see a new way to exchange contact details by simply placing two phones close together.

title: China warns Japan of ‘crushing’ defeat, tells Chinese citizens to shun visits
byline: China on Friday warned Japan of a “crushing” military defeat if it uses force to intervene over Taiwan, and even cautioned Chinese citizens against visits to Japan, angered by its prime minister’s remarks about the island, which Beijing claims.

title: Shah Rukh Khan becomes first actor to have a Dubai tower named after him
byline: Shah Rukh Khan was present at a grand event in Mumbai along with the founder and chairman of the Dubai-based Danube Group, Rizwan Sajan, as they unveiled a landmark property named Shahrukhz.

title: Gazette issued amending maximum retail prices of canned fish
byline: A Gazette notification has been issued amending the maximum retail prices imposed for canned fish, effective from today (15).

title: COPE reviews Colombo Port’s East Terminal delays & contractor’s Rs. 4,227M compensation claim
byline: Extended discussions were held at the Committee on Public Enterprises (COPE) regarding the delay in construction activities of the East Container Terminal of the Colombo Port and the circumstances that arose due to the delay of the entire project.

title: Trump says will sue BBC for up to US$5 billion over video edit
byline: US President Donald Trump said Friday (14) he would sue the BBC for up to US$5 billion after the British broadcaster apologised for a misleading edit of one of his speeches but said it would not pay damages.

title: Woman linked to ‘Kudu Salindu’ arrested with ‘Ice’ worth over Rs. 1 mln
byline: A woman suspected to be connected to the drug network of notorious underworld figure and drug kingpin ‘Kudu Salindu’ of Panadura has been arrested with crystal methamphetamine (‘Ice’) worth over Rs. 1 million during a raid at a house in Rukgaha Road, Arukgoda.

title: Over 1,000 more arrested in nationwide anti-drug raids
byline: A total of 1,056 suspects were arrested during 1,065 island-wide raids conducted within yesterday (14) under the “Nation United – National Drive” campaign aimed at eradicating narcotics from the country.

title: Several high-ranking cops including Senior DIGs transferred
byline: Several transfers and appointments involving high-ranking police officers have been made as per a decision of the National Police Commission (NPC).

title: Proposal to replace polythene bags with eco-friendly paper bags
byline: The Sectoral Oversight Committee on Environment, Agriculture and Resource Sustainability has proposed that the Ministry consider producing an environmentally friendly paper bag as an alternative to polythene bags.

title: Completion deadline extended for 2025 decentralized budget projects
byline: The Ministry of Finance has issued a circular to all District Secretaries regarding the project proposals approved under this year’s Decentralized Capital Budget Program.

title: Interim report on public service salary scheme presented to Ministerial Consultative Committee
byline: An interim report containing proposals and ideas for establishing the necessary framework and formal institution to develop a structured salary scheme and enhance professionalism in the public service was presented to the Ministerial Consultative Committee...

title: Derana Little Star winner Siheli’s viral video surpasses 312M views on YouTube
byline: A viral video clip of ‘Derana Little Star - Season 10’ winner, Siheli Thurya’s amazing performance during a reality show has now gained over 312.7 million views on TV Derana’s YouTube channel, becoming the single most-watched YouTube Short from a Sri Lankan channel.

title: Indonesia landslide kills 11 in Central Java, official says 12 missing
byline: A landslide after heavy rains in Central Java killed 11 people, Indonesia’s disaster management agency said on Saturday, adding that rescuers were searching for a dozen who are still missing.

title: Congo, M23 sign framework for peace in Qatar, more steps needed
byline: The Democratic Republic of Congo and the M23 rebel group signed on Saturday a framework agreement for a peace deal aimed at ending fighting in eastern Congo that has killed thousands of people and displaced hundreds of thousands more this year.

title: Sri Lanka looked to Gujarat model of development, says SL Envoy
byline: After meeting Gujarat Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel, Sri Lankan High Commissioner to India, Mahishini Colonne, said that Sri Lanka has looked up to Gujarat’s development ever since Prime Minister Narendra Modi was the Chief Minister there.
